meanings.definition: A person who is imprisoned with another person.
meanings.sent1: My coprisoner and I shared a cell in the prison.
meanings.sent2: The coprisoner and I became friends during our time in jail.
meanings.sent3: The coprisoner and I joked about our matching prison uniforms.
meanings.sent4: Being a coprisoner with someone can create a unique bond.
meanings.sent5: The coprisoner and I supported each other through our time behind bars.

meanings.definition: To be imprisoned with another person.
meanings.sent1: I never expected to coprisoner with my childhood friend.
meanings.sent2: He had to coprisoner with a stranger after the arrest.
meanings.sent3: We had to coprisoner due to a case of mistaken identity.
meanings.sent4: Being forced to coprisoner with someone can be challenging.
meanings.sent5: The two friends had to coprisoner after being caught by the police.
